meanings.sent1: The mud in the swamp became cloggier after the rain.
meanings.sent2: The drain was cloggier than usual due to all the hair stuck in it.
meanings.sent3: The peanut butter was so cloggier than glue that even the spoon got stuck!
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt cloggier than a traffic jam during rush hour.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog made the air cloggier, making it hard to see anything.

meanings.sent1: The narrow road became cloggier as more cars tried to pass through.
meanings.sent2: Her nose felt cloggier as she caught a cold.
meanings.sent3: The internet connection seemed cloggier than a slow-moving turtle.
meanings.sent4: The hallway was cloggier with students rushing to their next class.
meanings.sent5: The traffic in the city center was cloggier than a bottle neck.

meanings.definition: Full of or covered with clogs
meanings.sent1: The cloggier path through the forest was less traveled.
meanings.sent2: Her closet was cloggier with shoes than she realized.
meanings.sent3: The garden was cloggier with weeds than flowers.
meanings.sent4: The river was cloggier with debris after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The street was cloggier with parked cars than moving vehicles.
